cons: Pregnant woman and children should avoid larger fish with longer lifespans like swordfish and tuna because those can have higher levels of toxins, such as mercury.
description: Fish is one of the most beneficial protein sources for your diet.
It’s filled with essential nutrients, like omega-3 fatty acids, and is a great source of protein to keep your body lean and your muscles strong.
Fish is high in heart-healthy omega-3 fatty acids which can reduce inflammation, help protect your heart, and stave off chronic disease.
Fish oil is beneficial to clearing skin for people with moderate to severe acne.
Omega-3 fatty acids found in fish have also been shown to help treat liver disease.
name: Fish
pros: Fish is one of the most beneficial protein sources for your diet.
It’s filled with essential nutrients, like omega-3 fatty acids, and is a great source of protein to keep your body lean and your muscles strong.
Fish is high in heart-healthy omega-3 fatty acids which can reduce inflammation, help protect your heart, and stave off chronic disease.
Fish oil is beneficial to clearing skin for people with moderate to severe acne.
Omega-3 fatty acids found in fish have also been shown to help treat liver disease.
Fish are high in vitamin D, it is beneficial for calcium absorption for bone health and growth.
Omega-3 FA aid healthy brain function and infant development of vision and nerves during pregnancy.
Omega-3 FA prevent inflammation and reduce the risk of arthritis
Pregnant women and breastfeeding mothers should limit themselves to 150 g per month
serving: Nutritional information for Tuna cooked per 85g(3 oz.) serving
